We have some exciting news to share! Beginning Thursday, September 3, all students in the Fayette County School District will be able to eat both breakfast and lunch at no cost. Meals that are available to our virtual students, through our weekly meal pick-up, will also be available at no cost. Any extra items will still be available for purchase at their normal cost.

This is possible due to the USDA extending flexibilities that allowed us to provide free meals during COVID-19 school closures. We will be able to provide these meals at no cost to students through December 18, 2020, unless funding for the program is exhausted before that time. Fayette County School District is glad to be able to offer these meals at no cost to our students.

CALLING ALL SUBS! Due to a growing difficulty in getting substitutes, we will be opening the Substitute Application process up on Wednesday, November 1, 2017 instead of the scheduled December 1 date. We will accept applications through Friday, December 15, 2017. APPLICATIONS MAY NOT BE PICKED UP BEFORE WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 1, 2017.

If you or anyone you know would be interested in becoming a substitute, please encourage them to pick up an application packet from the Human Resources Department (Basement of County Annex Building behind the Courthouse) in the Superintendent's Office beginning on Wednesday, November 1, 2017.

Requirements for substituting are: 1) Must have a high school diploma or GED; 2) must obtain a background check through the state approved fingerprinting service; 3) Must obtain a Substitute Certificate from the Alabama State Department of Education; and, 4) and complete the necessary application paperwork.

If you have questions or need additional information, please contact Kay Pennington at (205) 932-4611, Ext. 232.
